required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Patient and Provider Intervention to Address Health Disparities in Lung Cancer Screening
clinical_study.official_title: A Multilevel Intervention to Address Health Disparities in Lung Cancer Screening

brief_summary.textblock: To test the impact of a multilevel intervention on primary (provider-patient communication, intentions, and knowledge) and secondary (screening referrals and completion) outcomes.

primary_outcome.description: Discussion about lung screening with the provider ('did you have a discussion with your doctor about lung screening?')
Screening intentions ('how likely is it that you will undergo lung screening in the next 6-months?')

secondary_outcome.description: Total number of lung screening orders captured via the electronic medical record
Total number of lung screening completions captured via the electronic medical record

intervention.intervention_name: Provider Prompt & Patient Outreach and Education
intervention.description: To target lack of provider-prompted discussion about lung screening, an electronic medical record (EMR) message will be sent to primary care providers prior to scheduled visits with screening-eligible patients to notify them of the patient's eligibility and to encourage discussion of the benefits and limitations of the test. To target patient-level knowledge about lung screening, an outreach specialist will educate screening-eligible patients about the benefits and limitations of the test prior to their visit.
